Topic: Law
Context: At a concert, exactly eight compositions—F, H, L, O, P, R, S, and T—are to be performed exactly once each, consecutively and one composition at a time. The order of their performance must satisfy the following conditions: T is performed either immediately before F or immediately after R. At least two compositions are performed either after F and before R, or after R and before F. O is performed either first or fifth. The eighth composition performed is either L or H. P is performed at some time before S. At least one composition is performed either after O and before S, or after S and before O.
Question: If T is performed fifth and F is performed sixth, then S must be performed either
Choices:
  A: fourth or seventh
  B: third or sixth
  C: third or fourth
  D: second or seventh
  E: first or fourth

Thought: 
T is performed fifth and F is performed sixth.
This means that R must be performed either third or fourth.
P is performed at some time before S.
This means that P must be performed either first, second, or third.
At least one composition is performed either after O and before S, or after S and before O.
This means that O must be performed either first, second, or seventh.
The eighth composition performed is either L or H.
This means that L or H must be performed eighth.
If S is performed fourth, then P must be performed first, O must be performed second, and L or H must be performed eighth.
If S is performed seventh, then P must be performed third, O must be performed first, and L or H must be performed eighth.
Therefore, S must be performed either fourth or seventh.
